context: [4] Proteinase K (50 Î¼g/ml) was added, and the suspension was incubated for 30 min at 37Â°C.  [5] The solution was extracted with phenol-chloroform-isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1).  [6] The pellet obtained after ethanol precipitation of the water phase was dissolved in 10 Î¼l of sterile distilled water and stored at âˆ’20Â°C.  [7] The DNA was used as a template for PCR amplification of an approximately 1,530-bp segment of the 16S rRNA gene with 2.5 mM MgCl2, an annealing temperature of 50Â°C, and 35 cycles.  [8] The PCR amplification primers used were pA (19EubFOR) (5â€²-GAGTTTGATCCTGGCTCAG-3â€²) and pHâ€² (1522REV) (5â€²-AAGGAGGTGATCCAGCCGCA-3â€²) .  [9] The amplification product was ligated in the pCR II vector and transformed into Escherichia coli cells from the TA cloning kit (Invitrogen). [10] Plasmid DNA of clones was isolated by using the FlexiPrep kit (Pharmacia P-L Biochemicals Inc.).
